column4: Can someone help me in this issue? i typed fglrxinfo in the terminal and instead of a working message is giving me a serious error....
as for the filte: look into synaptic : custom filters/broken
ok but how do i find out what package is broken and how to fix it?
i tried to install my ati card and ati catalyst...from this guide https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/ATI
you see it in synaptic - the 2nd answer - sorry - depends too much on what happened
i'm a new user  of linux so i can't know much stuff, i tried to install it did all the right steps restarted and when to test if the driver works, i typed in the terminal fglrxinfo and i get an eror
I have no experience with fglrx (my card is way too old) - I only had the one answer for you -- are you certain that your card is still supported by ATI?
If I install my graphic gard driver again would that solve the problem?
i checked the pdf on ubuntu guide if my card is supported and yes it is.
doesn't tell me anything - my question was not if ubuntu supports your card but if ATI does so
did all the right steps and after restart i got an eror in the terminal when running fglrx ....and if i go to hardware drivers, it's installed...
you sid that already - I cannot help you - sorry
that pdf was issued by ati, as i told you they support it.
don't have to be sorry, thanks anyway. :)
